t: Micah 1
The*p word of the Lord*s that came to Micah of Moresheth in the days of Jotham, Ahaz, and Hezekiah, kings of Judah, which he saw concerning Samaria and Jerusalem.
The Coming Destruction
Hear,*pn you peoples, all of you; pay*ld attention, O earth, and all that is in it, and*ln let the Lord God*s be a witness against you, the*ld Lord from his holy temple.
For*ln behold, the Lord*s is coming out of his place, and*ld will come down and tread upon the high places of the earth.
And*ln the mountains will melt under him, and*ld the valleys will split open, like*ln wax before the fire, like*ld waters poured down a steep place.

All*ln this is for the transgression of Jacob and*ld for the sins of the house of Israel. What*ln is the transgression of Jacob? Is*ld it not Samaria? And*ln what is the high place of Judah? Is*ld it not Jerusalem?
Therefore*ln I will make Samaria a heap in the open country, a*ld place for planting vineyards, and*ln I will pour down her stones into the valley and*ld uncover her foundations.

All*ln her carved images shall be beaten to pieces, all*ld her wages shall be burned with fire, and*ld all her idols I will lay waste, for*ln from the fee of a prostitute she gathered them, and*ld to the fee of a prostitute they shall return.
For*pn this I will lament and wail; I*ld will go stripped and naked; I*ln will make lamentation like the jackals, and*ld mourning like the ostriches.
For*ln her wound is incurable, and*ld it has come to Judah; it*ln has reached to the gate of my people, to*ld Jerusalem.
Tell*pn it not in Gath; weep*ld not at all; in*ln Beth-le-aphrah roll*ld yourselves in the dust.

Pass*ln on your way, inhabitants*ld of Shaphir, in*ld nakedness and shame; the*ln inhabitants of Zaanan do*ld not come out; the*ln lamentation of Beth-ezel shall*ld take away from you its standing place.
For*ln the inhabitants of Maroth wait*ld anxiously for good, because*ln disaster has come down from the Lord*s to*ld the gate of Jerusalem.
Harness*ln the steeds to the chariots, inhabitants*ld of Lachish; it*ln was the beginning of sin to*ld the daughter of Zion, for*ln in you were found the*ld transgressions of Israel.
Therefore*ln you shall give parting gifts to*ld Moresheth-gath; the*ln houses of Achzib shall be a deceitful thing to*ld the kings of Israel.
I*ln will again bring a conqueror to you, inhabitants*ld of Mareshah; the*ln glory of Israel shall*ld come to Adullam.
Make*ln yourselves bald and cut off your hair, for*ld the children of your delight; make*ln yourselves as bald as the eagle, for*ld they shall go from you into exile.
Micah 2
Woe to the Oppressors
Woe*pn to those who devise wickedness and*ld work evil on their beds! When*ln the morning dawns, they perform it, because*ld it is in the power of their hand.
They*ln covet fields and seize them, and*ld houses, and take them away; they*ln oppress a man and his house, a*ld man and his inheritance.

Therefore*ln thus says the Lord:*s behold,*ln against this family I am devising disaster, from*ld which you cannot remove your necks, and*ln you shall not walk haughtily, for*ld it will be a time of disaster.

In*ln that day they shall take up a taunt song against you and*ld moan bitterly, and*ln say, “We are utterly ruined; he*ld changes the portion of my people; how*ln he removes it from me! To*ld an apostate he allots our fields.”
Therefore*ln you will have none to cast the line by lot in*ld the assembly of the Lord.*s
“Do*pn not preach”— thus they preach— “one*ld should not preach of such things; disgrace*ld will not overtake us.”
Should*ln this be said, O house of Jacob? Has*ld the Lord*s grown impatient? Are*ld these his deeds? Do*ln not my words do good to*ld him who walks uprightly?
But*ln lately my people have risen up as an enemy; you*ln strip the rich robe from those who pass by trustingly with*ld no thought of war.
The*ln women of my people you drive out from*ld their delightful houses; from*ln their young children you take away my*ld splendor forever.
Arise*ln and go, for*ld this is no place to rest, because*ln of uncleanness that destroys with*ld a grievous destruction.
If*ln a man should go about and utter wind and lies, saying,*ld “I will preach to you of wine and strong drink,” he*ld would be the preacher for this people!

I*ln will surely assemble all of you, O Jacob; I*ld will gather the remnant of Israel; I*ln will set them together like*ld sheep in a fold, like*ln a flock in its pasture, a*ld noisy multitude of men.
He*ln who opens the breach goes up before them; they*ld break through and pass the gate, going*ld out by it. Their*ln king passes on before them, the*ld Lord*s at their head.
Micah 3
Rulers and Prophets Denounced
And*pn I said: Hear,*ln you heads of Jacob and*ld rulers of the house of Israel! Is*ln it not for you to know justice?—
you*ld who hate the good and love the evil, who*ln tear the skin from off my people and*ld their flesh from off their bones,
who*ln eat the flesh of my people, and*ld flay their skin from off them, and*ln break their bones in pieces and*ld chop them up like meat in a pot, like*ld flesh in a cauldron.
Then*pn they will cry to the Lord,*s but*ld he will not answer them; he*ln will hide his face from them at that time, because*ld they have made their deeds evil.

Thus*pn says the Lord*s concerning the prophets who*ld lead my people astray, who*ln cry “Peace” when*ld they have something to eat, but*ln declare war against him who*ld puts nothing into their mouths.
Therefore*ln it shall be night to you, without vision, and*ld darkness to you, without divination. The*ln sun shall go down on the prophets, and*ld the day shall be black over them;
the*ln seers shall be disgraced, and*ld the diviners put to shame; they*ln shall all cover their lips, for*ld there is no answer from God.
But*ln as for me, I am filled with power, with*ld the Spirit of the Lord,*s and*ld with justice and might, to*ln declare to Jacob his transgression and*ld to Israel his sin.
Hear*pn this, you heads of the house of Jacob and*ld rulers of the house of Israel, who*ln detest justice and*ld make crooked all that is straight,
who*ln build Zion with blood and*ld Jerusalem with iniquity.

Its*ln heads give judgment for a bribe; its*ld priests teach for a price; its*ld prophets practice divination for money; yet*ln they lean on the Lord*s and say, “Is*ld not the Lord*s in the midst of us? No*ld disaster shall come upon us.”
Therefore*ln because of you Zion*ld shall be plowed as a field; Jerusalem*ln shall become a heap of ruins, and*ld the mountain of the house a wooded height.
Micah 4
The Mountain of the Lord

It*pn shall come to pass in the latter days that*ld the mountain of the house of the Lord*s shall*ln be established as the highest of the mountains, and*ld it shall be lifted up above the hills; and*ln peoples shall flow to it,

and*ld many nations shall come, and say: “Come,*ln let us go up to the mountain of the Lord,*s to*ld the house of the God of Jacob, that*ln he may teach us his ways and*ld that we may walk in his paths.” For*ln out of Zion shall go forth the law, and*ld the word of the Lord*s from Jerusalem.

He*ln shall judge between many peoples, and*ld shall decide disputes for strong nations far away; and*ln they shall beat their swords into plowshares, and*ld their spears into pruning hooks; nation*ln shall not lift up sword against nation, neither*ld shall they learn war anymore;
but*ln they shall sit every man under his vine and under his fig tree, and*ld no one shall make them afraid, for*ld the mouth of the Lord*s of hosts has spoken.
For*ln all the peoples walk each*ld in the name of its god, but*ln we will walk in the name of the Lord*s our God forever*ld and ever.
The Lord Shall Rescue Zion
In*pn that day, declares the Lord,*s I*ld will assemble the lame and*ln gather those who have been driven away and*ld those whom I have afflicted;
and*ln the lame I will make the remnant, and*ld those who were cast off, a strong nation; and*ln the Lord*s will reign over them in Mount Zion from*ld this time forth and forevermore.
And*pn you, O tower of the flock, hill*ld of the daughter of Zion, to*ln you shall it come, the*ld former dominion shall come, kingship*ld for the daughter of Jerusalem.
Now*pn why do you cry aloud? Is*ld there no king in you? Has*ln your counselor perished, that*ld pain seized you like a woman in labor?

Writhe*ln and groan, O daughter of Zion, like*ld a woman in labor, for*ln now you shall go out from the city and*ld dwell in the open country; you*ld shall go to Babylon. There*ln you shall be rescued; there*ld the Lord*s will redeem you from*ld the hand of your enemies.
Now*pn many nations are*ld assembled against you, saying,*ln “Let her be defiled, and*ld let our eyes gaze upon Zion.”
But*ln they do not know the*ld thoughts of the Lord;*s they*ln do not understand his plan, that*ld he has gathered them as sheaves to the threshing floor.

Arise*ln and thresh, O*ld daughter of Zion, for*ln I will make your horn iron, and*ld I will make your hoofs bronze; you*ln shall beat in pieces many peoples; and*ld shall devote their gain to the Lord,*s their*ld wealth to the Lord of the whole earth.
Micah 5
The Ruler to Be Born in Bethlehem
Now*pn muster your troops, O daughter of troops; siege*ld is laid against us; with*ln a rod they strike the judge of Israel on*ld the cheek.

But*ln you, O Bethlehem Ephrathah, who*ld are too little to be among the clans of Judah, from*ln you shall come forth for me one*ld who is to be ruler in Israel, whose*ln coming forth is from of old, from*ld ancient days.
Therefore*ln he shall give them up until the time when*ld she who is in labor has given birth; then*ln the rest of his brothers shall return to*ld the people of Israel.

And*ln he shall stand and shepherd his flock in the strength of the Lord,*s in*ld the majesty of the name of the Lord*s his God. And*ln they shall dwell secure, for now he shall be great to*ld the ends of the earth.
And*ln he shall be their peace. When*pn the Assyrian comes into our land and*ld treads in our palaces, then*ln we will raise against him seven shepherds and*ld eight princes of men;

they*ln shall shepherd the land of Assyria with the sword, and*ld the land of Nimrod at its entrances; and*ln he shall deliver us from the Assyrian when*ld he comes into our land and*ld treads within our border.
A Remnant Shall Be Delivered
Then*pn the remnant of Jacob shall be in*ld the midst of many peoples like*ln dew from the Lord,*s like*ld showers on the grass, which*ln delay not for a man nor*ld wait for the children of man.

And*ln the remnant of Jacob shall be among the nations, in*ld the midst of many peoples, like*ln a lion among the beasts of the forest, like*ld a young lion among the flocks of sheep, which,*ln when it goes through, treads down and*ld tears in pieces, and there is none to deliver.
Your*ln hand shall be lifted up over your adversaries, and*ld all your enemies shall be cut off.
And*pn in that day, declares the Lord,*s I*ld will cut off your horses from among you and*ld will destroy your chariots;
and*ln I will cut off the cities of your land and*ld throw down all your strongholds;
and*ln I will cut off sorceries from your hand, and*ld you shall have no more tellers of fortunes;
and*ln I will cut off your carved images and*ld your pillars from among you, and*ln you shall bow down no more to*ld the work of your hands;
and*ln I will root out your Asherah images from among you and*ld destroy your cities.
And*ln in anger and wrath I will execute vengeance on*ld the nations that did not obey.
Micah 6
The Indictment of the Lord
Hear*pn what the Lord*s says: Arise,*ln plead your case before the mountains, and*ld let the hills hear your voice.
Hear,*ln you mountains, the indictment of the Lord,*s and*ld you enduring foundations of the earth, for*ln the Lord*s has an indictment against his people, and*ld he will contend with Israel.
“O*pn my people, what have I done to you? How*ld have I wearied you? Answer me!
For*ln I brought you up from the land of Egypt and*ld redeemed you from the house of slavery, and*ln I sent before you Moses, Aaron,*ld and Miriam.

O*ln my people, remember what Balak king of Moab devised, and*ld what Balaam the son of Beor answered him, and*ln what happened from Shittim to Gilgal, that*ld you may know the righteous acts of the Lord.”*s
What Does the Lord Require?
“With*pn what shall I come before the Lord,*s and*ld bow myself before God on high? Shall*ln I come before him with burnt offerings, with*ld calves a year old?
Will*ln the Lord*s be pleased with thousands of rams, with*ld ten thousands of rivers of oil? Shall*ln I give my firstborn for my transgression, the*ld fruit of my body for the sin of my soul?”
He*ln has told you, O man, what is good; and*ld what does the Lord*s require of you but*ln to do justice, and to love kindness, and*ld to walk humbly with your God?
Destruction of the Wicked
The*pn voice of the Lord*s cries to the city— and*ld it is sound wisdom to fear your name: “Hear*ln of the rod and of him who appointed it!
Can*ld I forget any longer the treasures of wickedness in the house of the wicked, and*ld the scant measure that is accursed?
Shall*ln I acquit the man with wicked scales and*ld with a bag of deceitful weights?
Your*ln rich men are full of violence; your*ld inhabitants speak lies, and*ld their tongue is deceitful in their mouth.
Therefore*ln I strike you with a grievous blow, making*ld you desolate because of your sins.
You*ln shall eat, but not be satisfied, and*ld there shall be hunger within you; you*ln shall put away, but not preserve, and*ld what you preserve I will give to the sword.
You*ln shall sow, but not reap; you*ld shall tread olives, but not anoint yourselves with oil; you*ld shall tread grapes, but not drink wine.

For*ln you have kept the statutes of Omri, and*ld all the works of the house of Ahab; and*ld you have walked in their counsels, that*ln I may make you a desolation, and your inhabitants a hissing; so*ld you shall bear the scorn of my people.”
Micah 7
Wait for the God of Salvation
Woe*pn is me! For I have become as*ld when the summer fruit has been gathered, as*ld when the grapes have been gleaned: there*ln is no cluster to eat, no*ld first-ripe fig that my soul desires.
The*ln godly has perished from the earth, and*ld there is no one upright among mankind; they*ln all lie in wait for blood, and*ld each hunts the other with a net.
Their*ln hands are on what is evil, to do it well; the*ld prince and the judge ask for a bribe, and*ln the great man utters the evil desire of his soul; thus*ld they weave it together.
The*ln best of them is like a brier, the*ld most upright of them a thorn hedge. The*ln day of your watchmen, of your punishment, has come; now*ld their confusion is at hand.
Put*ln no trust in a neighbor; have*ld no confidence in a friend; guard*ln the doors of your mouth from*ld her who lies in your arms;
for*ln the son treats the father with contempt, the*ld daughter rises up against her mother, the*ln daughter-in-law against her mother-in-law; a*ld man’s enemies are the men of his own house.
But*ln as for me, I will look to the Lord;*s I*ld will wait for the God of my salvation; my*ld God will hear me.
Rejoice*pn not over me, O my enemy; when*ld I fall, I shall rise; when*ln I sit in darkness, the*ld Lord*s will be a light to me.

I*ln will bear the indignation of the Lord*s because*ld I have sinned against him, until*ln he pleads my cause and*ld executes judgment for me. He*ln will bring me out to the light; I*ld shall look upon his vindication.

Then*ln my enemy will see, and*ld shame will cover her who said to me, “Where*ld is the Lord*s your God?” My*ln eyes will look upon her; now*ld she will be trampled down like*ld the mire of the streets.
A*pn day for the building of your walls! In*ld that day the boundary shall be far extended.
In*ln that day they will come to you, from*ld Assyria and the cities of Egypt, and*ln from Egypt to the River, from*ld sea to sea and from mountain to mountain.
But*ln the earth will be desolate because*ld of its inhabitants, for*ld the fruit of their deeds.

Shepherd*pn your people with your staff, the*ld flock of your inheritance, who*ln dwell alone in a forest in*ld the midst of a garden land; let*ln them graze in Bashan and Gilead as*ld in the days of old.
As*ln in the days when you came out of the land of Egypt, I*ld will show them marvelous things.
The*ln nations shall see and be ashamed of all their might; they*ln shall lay their hands on their mouths; their*ld ears shall be deaf;

they*ln shall lick the dust like a serpent, like*ld the crawling things of the earth; they*ln shall come trembling out of their strongholds; they*ld shall turn in dread to the Lord*s our God, and*ld they shall be in fear of you.
God’s Steadfast Love and Compassion

Who*pn is a God like you, pardoning iniquity and*ld passing over transgression for*ld the remnant of his inheritance? He*ln does not retain his anger forever, because*ld he delights in steadfast love.
He*ln will again have compassion on us; he*ld will tread our iniquities underfoot. You*ln will cast all our sins into*ld the depths of the sea.
You*ln will show faithfulness to Jacob and*ld steadfast love to Abraham, as*ln you have sworn to our fathers from*ld the days of old.
